generation0.title: What is a Pyramid?
generation0.passage: A pyramid is a large structure with a square or triangular base and sloping sides that meet at a point at the top. The ancient Egyptians are famous for building pyramids, especially the Great Pyramid of Giza. Pyramids were used as tombs for pharaohs and important people. The pyramid shape is very strong and can last for thousands of years.

generation1.title: The Great Pyramids of Giza
generation1.passage: The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. It was built around 4,500 years ago during the reign of Pharaoh Khufu. The pyramid was originally covered in shiny limestone, but most of the outer casing has been removed over time. The pyramid is still a mystery in many ways, as we do not know exactly how the ancient Egyptians built it, but it remains an incredible achievement.

generation2.title: Other Famous Pyramids
generation2.passage: While the pyramids of Egypt are the most famous, there are other pyramids around the world. In Mexico, the Mayans built large pyramids like the Pyramid of Kukulkan at Chichen Itza. The ancient Egyptians were not the only ones who used pyramids for important structures. Pyramids are also found in other parts of the world, such as Central America, China, and Sudan.
